alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 10:17PM MDT until June 16 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Washington, Logan and Morgan Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River near Balzac. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, There is extensive flooding of agricultural land near the river. Water flows over State Highway 63 near Atwood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.7 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday night or Friday. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 06/12/1995. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
